title: Stock Futures Inch Up Ahead of GDP Data; Results are due after the close from Amazon and Apple
text:
In Europe, the Stoxx Europe 600 meandered after the flat line in morning trade as gains in consumer staples and healthcare sectors were tempered by losses in energy and information technology sectors.

Anheuser-Busch InBev climbed 6.7% for a five-day run of gains and GlaxoSmithKline rose 2.4%.

The U.K.'s FTSE 100, which is dominated by large international businesses, was down 0.1%. Other stock indexes in Europe were mixed as France's CAC 40 added 0.2%, whereas the U.K.'s FTSE 250 fell 0.1% and Germany's DAX lost 0.2%.

The euro depreciated 0.1% against the U.S. dollar, with 1 euro buying $1.16. Meanwhile, the Swiss franc and the British pound were flat against the dollar.

In commodities, Brent crude slipped 0.8% to $83.22 a barrel. Gold gained 0.3% to $1,804.20 a troy ounce.

The German 10-year bund yield was up to minus 0.157% and the yield on 10-year U.K. government debt known as gilts strengthened to 0.993%. The yield on 10-year U.S. Treasurys rose to 1.556% from 1.528%. Yields move inversely to prices.

Stocks in Asia mostly fell as Hong Kong's Hang Seng declined 0.1%, Japan's Nikkei 225 index shed 1% and China's benchmark Shanghai Composite was lower 1.2%.

Stock Futures Inch Up Ahead of GDP Data
